# Text-to-Speech Support {.unnumbered}

## Text-to-Speech Support {.unnumbered}

Text-to-speech (TTS) tools are increasingly available and can enhance your learning experience by allowing you to listen to text on a webpage. These tools are especially helpful for individuals with low or no vision, as well as anyone who prefers listening while commuting, multitasking, or reinforcing understanding through audio.

If you’re interested in trying out a TTS tool, follow the instructions below based on your device and browser.

### For Microsoft Edge Users

Microsoft Edge includes a built-in **Read Aloud** feature that supports better comprehension and accessibility by letting you listen to webpage content. It’s ideal for hands-free learning or for reading along with the spoken text.

Note: *These instructions only apply if you're using Microsoft Edge as your browser.*

#### On Desktop (Windows/macOS):

1. Open your Moodle course page using Microsoft Edge.
   
2. Click the **Read Aloud** icon located in the top right corner of the browser.
   
![Find the shortcut key to Read Aloud on the top right corner.](assets/textToSpeech/desktop1.png){.lightbox}   

3. Click **Voice Options** to adjust the reading speed and voice preferences.
 
![Voice Options](assets/textToSpeech/desktop2.png){.lightbox} 

#### On Android Devices:

1. Install **Microsoft Edge** from the [Google Play Store](https://play.google.com/store/search?q=edge&c=apps&hl=en){target="_blank"}.
   
2. Open your Moodle course page in the Edge browser.
    
![MS Edge - Android Use](assets/textToSpeech/mobile1.jpeg){.lightbox width=375}

3. Tap the **Read Aloud** icon. 
   
![Reading Page](assets/textToSpeech/mobile2.jpeg){.lightbox width=375} 

4. Use the top-right menu to adjust **speed**, **voice**, and other **settings**.
   
![Adjust Speed and Voice](assets/textToSpeech/mobile3.jpeg){.lightbox width=375}
   
![More Settings](assets/textToSpeech/mobile4.jpeg){.lightbox width=375}

### For iPhone/iPad Users (Safari)

Apple devices have built-in text-to-speech support via Accessibility settings.

1. Go to **Settings > Accessibility > Spoken Content**.
    
![iOS Settings - Accessibility](assets/textToSpeech/ios1.jpg){.lightbox width=375}

![iOS Settings - Spoken Content](assets/textToSpeech/ios2.jpg){.lightbox width=375}  

2. Turn on **Speak Selection** and/or **Speak Screen**.
   
![iOS Settings - Speak Selection](assets/textToSpeech/ios3.jpg){.lightbox width=375} 

3. Open your Moodle course page in Safari.

4. To use:
   - **Speak Selection**: Select text and tap Speak.
  
    ![Speak Button](assets/textToSpeech/ios4.png){.lightbox width=375}  
  
   - **Speak Screen**: Swipe down with two fingers from the top of the screen to have the full screen read aloud.

    ![Swipe Down](assets/textToSpeech/ios5.png){.lightbox width=375}

::: {.note icon="true"}

If you want information on another tool, please reach out to [elearning@twu.ca](mailto:elearning@twu.ca).

:::
